1.title: Patti's Story
1.plot: Patti and Sherri met when they were 14 years old and have been committed friends ever since. Through Patti's story we understand what it means to be both a friend and a caregiver.

2.title: Tara's Story
2.plot: Tara's husband came back from Afghanistan both physically and mentally injured. Through her story we understand how caregiving for family members can sometimes have negative consequences.

3.title: Martina's Story
3.plot: As a family doctor, Martina has always been interested in the importance of touch. Through her story we understand how health care providers touch the lives of patients, and how patients can touch the lives of their physicians in return.

4.title: Sue's Story
4.plot: Follow the journey of Sue, the grandmother of a child with Cerebral Palsy, as she works with health narrative specialist Mike Lang to create a Digital Story about her caregiving experience. Sue's story reaffirms the truth of the phrase 'it takes a village', and emphasizes the integral role of all family members in caring for a child with disabilities.

5.title: Austin's Story
5.plot: Austin was a nurse for only a few months when she had a health crisis of her own. Through her story we understand how health care providers need to care for their patients, and each other.

6.title: Karine's Story
6.plot: Karine is a social worker who provides care for thousands of young adult cancer patients and survivors across Canada. Through her story we understand how we can care for people from a distance while taking care of ourselves.

7.title: Roger's Story
7.plot: Roger is a hard working bread delivery driver caring for his wife and daughter. Through his story we understand how feelings of guilt are a real challenge for everyone in caregiving relationships.

8.title: Nora's Story
8.plot: Nora is a retired librarian who was asked to take on the power of attorney for her friend and neighbour. Through her story we understand how important it is for all members of society to care for the people around them.

9.title: Gwen's Story
9.plot: Gwen's husband suffered a severe brain injury and needs constant care. Through her story we understand the importance of being a strong advocate for the ones we love, to make sure they get the support they need.

locations: St. John's, Newfoundland, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada::(location)
imdb.plot outline: We are all Caregivers. Kids, adults, neighbours, friends, doctors, patients. But sometimes it can be hard to make sense of our role as Caregivers. We often don't know our own story until someone asks us to tell it - and listens. Follow the journey of 9 Caregivers, as they work with health narrative specialist Mike Lang to create a Digital Story about their caregiving experience. Through the process they not only find their story, they learn how to share it with the people that matter most to them. These stories explore what it truly means to be there for the people in our lives.
imdb.title: Being There
plot: Join health narrative expert Mike Lang as he helps caregivers see their place in the story.

We are all Caregivers. Kids, adults, neighbours, friends, doctors, patients. But sometimes it can be hard to make sense of our role as Caregivers. We often don't know our own story until someone asks us to tell it - and listens. Follow the journey of 9 Caregivers, as they work with health narrative specialist Mike Lang to create a Digital Story about their caregiving experience. Through the process they not only find their story, they learn how to share it with the people that matter most to them. These stories explore what it truly means to be there for the people in our lives.
